comments.body: I once heard (but I might be wrong) that it could be better to use version constraints in the requirements below (`- python >=3.6`), rather than using the `skip` directive.

IIUC (for arch specific builds) you should just use plain `python` and constrain with selectors as above.

I'm not sure I follow entirely but details are in https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-smithy/issues/904

> From @isuruf on the conda-forge gitter channel: gitter.im/conda-forge/conda-forge.github.io?at=5bbb8adb271506518dd861b7
>
>> python matrix builds are used if you have just - python as a requirement.
>> python >= 3.5 means conda-build can use any python version >= 3.5 as a run requirement, but what we actually want is the python version that it built against as the run requirement‚Äù
oh yes, you are correct, thanks for pointing me to those discussions

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +12,16 @@build:
  number: 0
  skip: True  # [py<36]
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps --ignore-installed --no-cache-dir -vvv"
